intro: Astracantha talassea, commonly known as the Talasean star-thorn, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers and thorn-covered stems. It typically grows in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
